snippet: Economic data released on Tuesday showed the largest decline in manufacturing production since January 2014. Retail sales and business inventories, however, had modest gains.
abstract: Commerce Department reports retail sales rose 0.2 percent in August, after rising 0.7 percent in July; Federal Reserve reports industrial production fell 0.5 percent in August.
lead_paragraph: Economic data released on Tuesday showed the largest decline in manufacturing production since January 2014. Retail sales and business inventories, however, had modest gains.

headline.main: Manufacturing Weakens, Led by Drop in Auto Production
headline.print_headline: In Uneven Recovery, Bright Spot Is Retailing
